name: 'The State Dinner' Multiple Choice Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 1 | 15 Questions

questions.text: How much money did Sam offer Laurie to not go home with Carl Everett?
questions.explanation:
$10,000.

	Sam offered Laurie the money after Mrs. Bartlet had walked away from the two of them.

True.

	In the last scene of the episode, Josh wrapped his arms around Mandy while they listened to the President talk to the man over the speaker phone.

questions.text: Which future cast member's character made their first appearance on the show?
questions.explanation:
Abigail Bartlet & abbey bartlet.

	Stockard Channing plays Doctor Abigail Bartlet.

questions.text: What was the name of the man that President Bartlet talked to over the phone at the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Harold.

	Bartlet: "Well, I don't know, Harold. I think I'd ask for my money back."

questions.text: Who told the President to send a hostage negotiator into Mclean, Idaho?
questions.explanation:
Mandy.

	Josh: "It bugs me when the President listens to other people besides me."

questions.text: Where was the visiting President from?
questions.explanation:
Indonesia.

	His name was President Sugito and he didn't speak very much.

questions.text: Danny told Donna that CJ would need her help.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Danny told Carol that CJ was going to need her help finding out about the Vermeil that was being used at the state dinner.

questions.text: Dr. Steven Colson specialized in what kind of medicine?
questions.explanation:
Cardiology.

	Abbey introduced CJ to Steven and his family and then tried to fix her up with him.

questions.text: Sam and Laurie were eating sandwiches at the diner.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Sam and Laurie were eating ham and tuna salad sandwiches, but Sam couldn't decide which one he wanted to eat so Laurie told him the tuna salad was her sandwich. Sam ate her sandwich anyway.

questions.text: Does Josh know what his job is?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Josh (to Mandy): "It's never been made clear to me."

questions.text: How many languages does the cook speak?
questions.explanation:
2.

	The cook speaks Batak and Portugese.

questions.text: Did Danny called CJ a weak press secretary?
questions.explanation:
No.

	CJ: "Yeah, but you were thinking it."

questions.text: What magazine wanted to know what wine was being served with dinner?
questions.explanation:
'Mirabella'.

	Josh: "What wine are we---?" CJ: "It's wine. You'll drink it."

questions.text: Who asked Toby if he knew that sorcerers were executed in Indonesia?
What did President Bartlet call the table that Josh, CJ, Toby and Sam were sitting at?
questions.explanation:
The fun table.

	Bartlet: "Yeah, that's the fun table."
